bio.short: I'm a computational neuroscience graduate student at University of Colorado Denver, I am focused in the computational modeling of neural systems and applications in artificial intelligence.

brainCriticality.overview: This research explores the hypothesis that the brain operates at or near a critical state, similar to physical systems at phase transitions. Critical systems exhibit unique properties like long-range correlations, power-law distributions, and optimal information processing.
brainCriticality.methodology: Using computational models based on statistical physics, we investigate how neural networks might self-organize toward criticality and how this affects information processing capabilities.
brainCriticality.demoDescription: The Ising model is a fundamental model in statistical physics that exhibits a phase transition. It serves as a useful analogy for understanding criticality in neural systems. This interactive simulation demonstrates how systems behave differently at, below, and above the critical temperature.

keyFindings.title: Optimal Information Processing
keyFindings.description: Systems at criticality maximize information transmission, storage, and processing capabilities, potentially explaining why the brain might operate near this regime.

keyFindings.title: Scale-Free Dynamics
keyFindings.description: Neural activity patterns in critical systems exhibit scale-free properties, similar to neurophysiological recordings from real brains.

keyFindings.title: Self-Organized Criticality
keyFindings.description: Our models demonstrate how neural networks can self-organize toward critical states through plasticity mechanisms and homeostatic regulation.

implications.intro: Understanding brain criticality has profound implications for neuroscience, artificial intelligence, and treating neurological disorders:
points: New perspectives on neural information processing and brain function
Insights into neurological disorders as deviations from critical states
Design principles for more efficient artificial neural networks
Novel therapeutic approaches targeting the restoration of critical dynamics
